items.name: Ext.util.Region
items.text:
This class represents a rectangular region in X,Y space, and performs geometric
transformations or tests upon the region.

This class may be used to compare the document regions occupied by elements.

items.name: adjust
items.text: Modifies the current region to be adjusted by offsets.

items.name: top
items.text: Top offset

items.name: right
items.text: Right offset

items.name: bottom
items.text: Bottom offset

items.name: left
items.text: Left offset
this

items.name: constrainTo
items.text: Modifies the current region to be constrained to the targetRegion.
this

items.name: constructor
items.text: Creates a region from the bounding sides.

items.name: top
items.text: The topmost pixel of the Region.

items.name: right
items.text: The rightmost pixel of the Region.

items.name: bottom
items.text: The bottom pixel of the Region.

items.name: left
items.text: The leftmost pixel of the Region.

items.name: contains
items.text: Checks if this region completely contains the region that is passed in.

items.name: copy
items.text: Create a copy of this Region.

items.name: copyFrom
items.text: Copy the values of another Region to this Region

items.name: p
items.text: The region to copy from.
This Region

items.name: equals
items.text: Check whether this region is equivalent to the given region

items.name: region
items.text: The region to compare with

items.text: the point

items.name: p

items.name: getOutOfBoundOffsetY

items.name: p

items.name: getSize
items.text: Get the width / height of this region
an object with width and height properties

items.name: hasOwnProperty
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

Returns true if object contains specified property; else
returns false.

items.name: intersect
items.text: Checks if this region intersects the region passed in.
Returns the intersected region or false if there is no intersection.

items.name: isOutOfBound
items.text: Check whether the point / offset is out of bound

items.name: p
items.text: the point / offset

items.name: isOutOfBoundX
items.text: Check whether the offset is out of bound in the x-axis

items.name: p
items.text: the offset

items.name: isOutOfBoundY
items.text: Check whether the offset is out of bound in the y-axis

items.name: p
items.text: the offset

items.name: isPrototypeOf
prototype
items.text:
an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the
*object* argument

items.name: object
items.text: the object whose prototype chain will be searched
Returns true if object is a prototype and false if not.

items.name: propertyIsEnumerable
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

If the object does not have the specified property, this
method returns false.

items.name: restrict
items.text: Restrict a point within the region by a certain factor.

items.name: restrictX
items.text: Restrict an offset within the region by a certain factor, on the x-axis

items.name: factor
items.text: The factor.

items.name: restrictY
items.text: Restrict an offset within the region by a certain factor, on the y-axis

items.name: factor
items.text: The factor, defaults to 1

items.name: round
items.text: Round all the properties of this region
this This Region

items.name: toLocaleString
items.text: Returns a string representing the object. This method is meant to be overridden by derived objects for locale-specific purposes. Objects toLocaleString returns the result of calling toString. This function is provided to give objects a generic toLocaleString method, even though not all may use it. Currently, only Array, Number, and Date override toLocaleString.
Object represented as a string.

items.name: toString

items.text: Object represented as a string.

items.name: translateBy
items.text: Translate this Region by the given offset amount

items.name: x
items.text:
Object containing the `x` and `y` properties.
Or the x value is using the two argument form.

items.name: y
items.text: The y value unless using an Offset object.
this This Region

items.name: union
items.text: Returns the smallest region that contains the current AND targetRegion.
a new region

items.name: valueOf
items.text: Returns the primitive value of the specified object. JavaScript calls the valueOf method to convert an object to a primitive value. You rarely need to invoke the valueOf method yourself; JavaScript automatically invokes it when encountering an object where a primitive value is expected. By default, the valueOf method is inherited by every object descended from Object. Every built- in core object overrides this method to return an appropriate value. If an object has no primitive value, valueOf returns the object itself, which is displayed as: [object Object] You can use valueOf within your own code to convert a built-in object into a primitive value. When you create a custom object, you can override `Object.valueOf` to call a custom method instead of the default Object method. You can create a function to be called in place of the default valueOf method. Your function must take no arguments. Suppose you have an object type `myNumberType` and you want to create a valueOf method for it. The following code assigns a user-defined function to the object's valueOf method: myNumberType.prototype.valueOf = new Function(functionText) With the preceding code in place, any time an object of type `myNumberType` is used in a context where it is to be represented as a primitive value, JavaScript automatically calls the function defined in the preceding code. An object's valueOf method is usually invoked by JavaScript, but you can invoke it yourself as follows: myNumber.valueOf() Note: Objects in string contexts convert via the toString method, which is different from String objects converting to string primitives using valueOf. All objects have a string conversion, if only `"[object type]"`. But many objects do not convert to number, boolean, or function.
Returns value of the object or the object itself.

items.name: constructor
prototype
items.text: Allows the addition of properties to all objects of type Object.

items.name: from
items.text: Creates a Region from a "box" Object which contains four numeric properties `top`, `right`, `bottom` and `left`.

items.name: o
items.text: An object with `top`, `right`, `bottom` and `left` properties.
region The Region constructed based on the passed object

items.name: getRegion
items.text: Retrieves an Ext.util.Region for a particular element.

items.name: el
items.text: An element ID, htmlElement or Ext.Element representing an element in the document.
region
